title: 107_hr1623
content: The Act may be cited as the "Historically Women's Public Colleges or Universities Historic Building Restoration and Preservation Act". Definitions are provided in Section 2. SEC. 2. DEFINITIONS. This section defines key terms used in the Act, including "historically women's public college or university," "historic building or structure," and "Secretary." Preservation and restoration grants are provided for historic buildings and structures at historically women's public colleges or universities. The Secretary awards grants to historically women's public colleges or universities for preserving and restoring historic buildings and structures on their campuses. Grants are funded through the National Historic Preservation Act for fiscal years 2002 through 2006. Grant conditions include obtaining Secretary's approval for any alterations to the property. The Secretary awards grants to historically women's public colleges or universities for preserving and restoring historic buildings and structures on their campuses. Grantees must agree to conditions such as obtaining approval for alterations and allowing public access for interpretive and educational purposes. Funds may only be used for buildings or structures listed on the National Register of Historic Places, National Historic Landmarks, or within designated historic districts.
